title: Deregulating Workers’ Rights Will Not Save European Industry — It Will Only Deepen the Crisis [Promoted Content]
summary_full: Europe’s industrial crisis stems from high energy costs, weak demand and global competition — not workers’ rights. Deregulating labour protections worsens instability. A credible strategy requires investment, fair competition, clean energy and strong social standards to rebuild competitiveness without sacrificing workers or democracy.
